dialogues.text: Alonzo's wife, Francine, is bound - clothes torn - to a c in a TV room.  On the floor are two young boys bound with plastic ties.  Paper bags are over their heads.  Francine eyes are as large as saucers.  Around her neck is a neckl of C-4 explosive connected to a detonator. STEVENS (cont'd) (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I gave them up, man!  Gave up the Feds!  Gave up everything I knew.  Now I got to go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd they get onto you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know?  But it was from the get-go.  Knew the FBI had run me into them. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, I gotta go...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and a Miami PD SWAT team crash through the front door. Another team through the back.  Trudy in a tactical vest second in with a 12-gauge.  The house is empty.  Gina and other detectives hang in the rear.  First SWAT team "clea the living room, dining room.  Second clears the kitchen, maid's quarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...last room to clear...center of the house.  SWAT teams appear around corners.  Weapons up.  The looks on their f tell us nobody is here...nobody alive...and what they see gives even these veterans pause as blood pools around the legs of a family and overturned chairs.  Alonzo didn't sa anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after changing channel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sonny...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on police radio listens to a message from Trudy while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tubbs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta, I gotta go...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice cracks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonzo, you don't need to go home. Now Alonzo knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said they wouldn't hurt them, wouldn't hurt them if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They been known to do that... Alonzo Stevens has a strange look in his eyes.  He looks Crockett and Tubbs, as if to say something.  He doesn't. Crockett and Tubbs walk towards him, to reach him...to console him...

dialogues.speaker: BUT ALONZO STEVENS
dialogues.text: backs away.  Looks at them sadly.  And before they can st him, he steps out onto the freeway, opens his arms, and embraces the front bumper of a 70 m.p.h. 18-wheeler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grim, silent, race through Miami traffic to the crime sce we know is ahead because... OVER TUBBS' SHOULDER we see all the lights from two dozen emergency vehicles a quarter mile ahead.  Death is not procedural or casual, not when it's somebody you know, li an informant you worked cases with.  Cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarter mile away.  We see the lights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking cell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know these people...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grieve elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in a concrete space.  We've entered mid-scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not certain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Nazi Low-riders...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not certain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think NLR.  We don't know! Alonzo only fronted as a broker for our guys to make the meet.  He wasn't deep into the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White gangs...?  It doesn't track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White gangs is tweakers and a crystal meth lab in a trailer park. Bounce around the old lady Saturday night and get your recidivist ass busted back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.  This is a distribution network out of South Florida, moving poly-drug loads, crystal meth through coke, to Nashville, Atlanta, Memphis, Cleveland.  And computer fraud, identity theft. It's like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the point)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knew about Alonzo, before he made a move on them.  They had our operation.  They've cut into us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break your encryption?  Hack your e- mail?  Employee databases? Somebody on the inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.  And that's the point.  Maybe there's a mole. Whatever, it's a disaster.  And         it's a Joint Interagency Task Force.  I have DEA, ATF, U.S. Customs components in on it.  So the penetration could be from any one agency.  What we do know is I have to suspend operations right now from undercover work through interdictions 'cause I have to assume our Operational Security is blown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in, your ass is dead in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Miami PD wasn't part of the J.I.T.  And from what Alonzo said, he didn't give you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To recruit you. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I didn't want you around the crime scene because it's crawling with federal law enforcement.  We don't know who's straight up, who's not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recruit us to do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get into business with this crew, identify them.  Illuminate their network.  If you're lucky, discover their source, how they penetrated us.  We'll indict and take it from there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do that?  Make a buy? (wry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That went well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse undercover?  WE supply to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got a steady stream of supply. So, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From whom...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Colombian producer.  Named Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the North Valle area.  New. Low-level, we think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aryan brothers are not going to change-up suppliers.  So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transpo?  How they bringing the loads in...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not.  They collect in Miami.  Montoya, the producer, handles deliveries.  That's his end, and he varies the routes.  We got some FLIR off an AWAC of a coupla go-fast boats, on one run, that's all. Fujima boots up his military-spec laptop to view the FLIR video.  Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Track with me, here... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knew the "Russians" were undercover Feeb?  They should have no-showed.  But, no, these guys show anyway, and commit murder upon federal officers.  And steal all your money... (beat; to Fujima)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that say to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speculating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says, "We do not fear you." (to Fujima)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says, "Fuck off and die."  It says, "We get down for recreation..." Fujima's Dell laptop glows to life.  Two almost indistinguishable boats and their wakes are SEEN. CROCKETT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow that up... Crockett's attention goes to something atypical he spots about the wake emerging behind each boat.  He exchanges a look with Tubbs.  But they say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could try to run loads into these guys. (to Fujima)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run a few loads for Montoya into South Florida.  Into this group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to consider a few issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Crockett + Tubbs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you'd be operating outside territorial United States.  Your         badges do not count.  You have no         authorization to carry weapons.  If you're busted, it could take a long time to get you re-patriated.  And         there's no backup...         (to Fujima)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you will share with them all         your intel on Montoya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean full disclosure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  From my side, I don't         WANT to know anything about what you're doing or how you do it... (to Castillo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let me know if we're on... Fujima splits.  Castillo waits until Fujima's car pulls a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tubbs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the Stevens family, I'm sorry.  I know you were close to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the kids' godfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intuits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And" what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to know.  There is never any room for "personal"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Tubbs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is fine.  And we know the jokes. When it gets vengeful, things get         messy.  When they get messy the wrong people die... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the answer is "yes." (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she met Alonzo, once upon a time, a long time ago. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet it was personal. ...and is now compartmentalized in the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you spot...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three wakes off the back of those boats.  Who runs three Sterling engines off a deep-V hull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sal Maguda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's gonna persuade Montoya to         change off Sal Maguda running his         deliveries...? It's a rhetorical question.

dialogues.speaker: BOATS
dialogues.text: They're two feet out of the water on their dry dock, next a Marine Shed. It's an unlikely location because derelict factories, che apartments, weeds and marine scrap metal are the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and a SWAT team in the weeds across the river.  They incl SGT. JEAN-LOUIS BASTIDE, a Haitian in dark sweats.  They are in plain clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odile, she say they're pregnant... We don't know what that means, yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Okay.  Only Jean-Louis and I do the talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both steel doors EXPLODE as if their molecular structure, itself, disintegrated from one BLAST of Tubbs M-40 grenad launcher firing a canister of ball bearings like a king-s shotgun on steroids as...

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: react, but Crockett draws down on one with an AK-47.  Bas wounds the second GUARD who had drawn down his H & K. Third Guard begs to live in French Patois.  They own the place.  And Crockett sees... 800 individually-wrapped bricks of North Valle Colombian cocaine are on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comme on dit... (Like they said...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charger et les recoit d'ici... (Load 'em up and get out of here...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy?  Que fais-tu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que faisons-nous?  De qu'a-t-il l'air, fou!  Nous voulons tous votre drugs. (What are we doing?  What's it look like we're doing, fool?  We are stealing all your dope.) Suburban crashes through the wreckage of the door and bac to the table.  Jean-Louis and SWAT #1 start throwing bric into the back.  Tubbs with Crockett exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: approach the two deep V-hull go-fast boats with three eng off the back.  Tubbs cracks the breech of the grenade launcher and loads a 40-millimeter shell, while he stroll down the dock...

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: tosses two Willie Peters (white phosphorus grenades) into boats.  Tubbs fires the M-40 at a third boat, which explo flame, followed by...

dialogues.speaker: TWO CARNATIONS OF WHITE PHOSPHORESCENCE
dialogues.text: destroy the smuggler's Strykers, which we saw in Fujima's video.  Crockett + Tubbs have just put Sal Maguda out of business.  They walk away and around the side of the shed disregarding the curious citizens of Little Haiti, come t watch the fireworks...

dialogues.speaker: BRILLIANT DAYLIGHT
dialogues.text: drive.  Crockett reaches into a paper bag full of cell ph and grabs one.  He dials up a number, grabs another and h it to Tubbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sailor... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm good. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a hole in the calendar...looking to charge up the cash flow. (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, later. Crockett struck out.  While...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nicholas, my ace.  Wha's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.  Same old...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got idle all of an instant.  You got something from somewhere that's got to go someplace, somewhen, which is not too distantly in the future...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the guy with the white hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is fortuitous that you called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corrosion and decay.  People look coldly at us.  Malevole and malefaction on every corner.  No one's picked up the garbage for a month.  Poverty in the Caribbean half-light CROCKETT & TUBBS cross the street to CAMERA from their rental car.  The La Perla section was a 16th Century haven for pirates.  It's little civic improvements in 400 years. They enter a nightclub - shabby neon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no customers.  They're cautious.  Men stop them and frisk them.  They expected that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from Nicholas to meet JosГ©... They're waved to the rear.  They start towards a back tab A small group of people wait...

dialogues.speaker: OVER CROCKETT
dialogues.text: He's a former right-wing Colombian paramilitary from the North Valle near the Pacific coast.  He runs operations, communications and security.  He has cold eyes and a corp face.  He's notorious for using torture to ferret-out informants.  Right now he watches these two Americans approach.  Security people are on either side of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extends hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JosГ©...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny Burnett...this is my partner, Rico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. As Crockett sits, he notices that at a table a few to the side is a woman.  This is ISABELLA.  Behind glasses, she seems immobile, filled with intelligence, well-dressed in subdued Tom Ford and staring at him.  Reading him.  Crock holds the look that extra beat and turns back to business

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Security)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dos cafГ©. He's security, not a fucking waiter.  But Yero nods. Security fetches coffee, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So lay it out, my brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas said you okay.  That's nice.  But how I know if you any         good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you run loads for?  Cause other         than Nicholas, you knows you? Tubbs looks at Crockett.  They thought it was a done deal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dark)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mommy and daddy know me. Isabella tilts her head imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we didn't come down here to         audition.  Business auditions for         us... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and know who we are and know         they want their load run by us         before Nicholas calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way we do not waste AvGas or our motherfucking time. Yero's security reacts to the tone and raises weapons.  A start up out of their chair as...

dialogues.speaker: ZITO
dialogues.text: appear at the door, SMGs from shoulder straps.  Zito flip D14 hand grenade which Crockett snatches out of the air, pulls the pin and slams on the table.  Everyone FREEZES. Only Crockett's hand pressure restrains the clip. CROCKETT (cont'd) (goes right up in Yero's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to "know" shit?  Who the         fuck are you?  You got a side deal         with U.S. Customs to open up the         coast in a few spots...in exchange you flip them some gringo runners? Like us...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wearing a wire?         Tubbs rips open Yero's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or DEA?  The Feeb?         Yero's shirt...open to the waist.  No wire.  Yero's furio Yero's people have weapons pointed their way.  They outnu Switek and Zito.  Slack's taken up on triggers.  It's on edge.  And the edge is overloaded.  Tubbs reads that, war Yero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People gonna walk into this place and say, "Ola, hijo!  That some         crazy wallpaper.  Whew...it wild!         Is that a Jackson Pollack?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "No, viejo.  That was JosГ© Yero, splattered all over his motherfucking wall."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can close each other's eyes right now.  Real easy.  Real fast. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, then, nobody makes any money...         Yero gestures his security to calm down....one notch. Crockett and Tubbs still hold the grenades. Then Crockett opens his shirt.  No wires.  So does Tubbs. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Equipment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow and low, Adam A-500s... (Yero looks quizzical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...carbon composite, stealthy, 1400 nautical-mile range, thousand ki payload...all the way to Caravels and 727's from a source country to a transshipment point.  Small freighters.  We've done containers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And specialize in very fast go-fast boats for coastal runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't talk weight.  We talk logistics. Isabella sits, watching this.  She drinks her coffee. JOSГ‰ YERO (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get longs and lats for the pickup.  Open ocean.  You run it in.  On shore, our people receive the loads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people on shore who handle a load we run are our people, not your         people.  No tweakers, dopers, first-         timers we don't know.  They didn't do time with us, they ain't doing crime with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you get from us is a date.  A place.  "In the parking lot of a Jack-in-the-Box in north Miami."  At such-and-such time, an eighteen-         wheeler will be there.  Keys in the ignition.  Ready to roll.  You pick         it up.  And you drive it... (waves his left hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money thing is done in advance in         places where there are no guns. Because when money and guns get         together, there is violence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You afraid of violence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not John Wayne.  There is no         "S" on his chest.  We get down if         the play calls for it.  But we are into business and making money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And violence is extra.  And expensive.  So how much weight you looking to move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  'Cause how you do         delivery on the beach, I don't like.  Maybe this does not work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it don't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the last transporter you had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we need this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red light, green light, JosГ©?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't answer, leans back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm also called "Cochi Loco."  That means "Crazy pig."  'Cause I enforce security and get people to         tell me what I need to know.  That         part of what I do, you never want         to find out about. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other people will negotiate the         money and go or not go.  Not me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what were we talking to you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to lay eyes on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...? Isabella watches Crockett...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tubbs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem okay. (to Tubbs re: Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But him?  I don't like... how he         looks... Everything goes from tense to lethal.  Has Yero made them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I care what you think about how he looks?  You wanna fuck my         partner or do business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait by the phone. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get a call.  Or maybe you don't.  Until then, piss off back to where you come from... Crockett flips the hand grenade and catches it with his l hand...and he drops it in front of JosГ© Yero.  It spins the table.  He had reinserted the pin.  And they back out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contemplative.  Offscreen a door opens.  Entering is Gina Calabrese.  She's naked.  She washes his back.  She dumps much shampoo on his head.  He tries to clear it from his eyes.  Laughs.  They start to make love under the water, the steam, through the misted glass, offscreen we hear an engine rumble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sonny can wait. Tubbs and Gina are not random lovers, they're in love.  T look in her eyes, the openness is pure femininity behind Bronx presentation.  She smiles, touches the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ties up a 75' Sun Seeker.  It looks like a 38' deep-V offshore racer on growth hormones.  Crockett's alone, as fades over the '60's ranch house on the river.  It's unde tropical trees, with one strip of white neon utility ligh outlining the flat eave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: let himself in.  He's at a kitchen stool at the counter w Tubbs enters in sweats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Gina enters in a robe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hi, Gina.  Hi, Sonny."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Gina. (putting shopping bag on table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from Frick and Frack. Trudy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re:  bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we got? Crockett pulls out three overly-large cell phones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellite.  New encryption. Supposedly sharper than the G... (to Gina)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How good's our background? Tubbs and Crockett look at the Mac screen as Gina boots i up.  Gina's fingers tap dance on the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so not the PD, if you got busted on a DUI, you're in serious trouble...you're bad men back to grammar school. (to Tubbs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Quentin.  Pelican Bay. (to Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine Corps.  Statesville. Pelican Bay, where you guys hooked up.  Now you're too smart and too fast to get jacked again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will it stand up?

dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cruises storefront churches, chacouteries, Baptist missio Haitian restaurants and palm trees.  Men in dark trousers white shirts lean in doorways.  The SUV preceding Yero st three houses before us.  The Excursion with Yero stops tw houses beyond.  Security - very casually - deploys.  NOW, Yero approaches...seen through the curtains of the window we're looking through.  Reveal Tubbs watching. And, he crosses to the door and opens it as Yero cautious enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his face registers surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: DOPE
dialogues.text: Carefully stacked in the living room are the PLASTIC-WRAP

dialogues.speaker: MAGUDA'S WAREHOUSE WHEN THEY BLEW UP HIS BOATS.
dialogues.text: Hog-tied and bleeding all over his clothes, in the corner Neptune.  His mouth is taped.  He's shaking his head...disclaiming, disowning and disavowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the load you lost a while back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.  He try to take tonight's load?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do I do with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.  Like we said, we're not into violence. Yero looks around the corner and sees Switek and Zito in dining room, casually at ease with Galil assault rifles...meaning "don't even think about it"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty mansion is on its own peninsula.  Through the windows we see a yacht and Crockett's 48' Stryker, its ca open but without its racing supergraphics.  The mansion interior...all Beaumaniers limestone...is devoid of all furnishing.  They sit on white plastic garden chairs from Sears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk into Neptune's house...very nice.  But I also see you... and our drugs that got ripped from Maguda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like us finding your load?  We can go and lose it all over again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout this?  How'd Neptune know where to hit us?  Huh?  Whose Op sec's got a leak?  Yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd Neptune tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't.  Interrogation's not in our skill set. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So c'mon, what suspicions have you master-minded off these associations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers in Spanish to Isabella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what this is...ask how much they want to turn back to us our load... Yero's certain about their motive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the recovery?  How much are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's "nothing"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  As in "free, gratis."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as an investment in the future...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes off her glasses and looks at Crockett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Future" of...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine...business...relationship... She holds Crockett's look...as she did before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours cause what's yours, is yours.  And what's ours is ours... (to Yero)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...like the second ten-percent, which is now due, Yero, my ace. Isabella gestures.  Yero kicks across the floor a cardboa box full of money.  Tubbs glances inside.  Doesn't count TUBBS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up next?  Or is this a one- time deal? Isabella decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yero)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give them the shipment on the seventeenth... Yero doesn't like it.  She gestures "do it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conveyance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maritime.  Jose will fill you in. And she starts to leave...and sensing Crockett's gotten u and follows her.  Meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yero)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay it out... And Crockett, close behind Isabella, now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one thing you can do for me in recognition of the death- defying risks we took to recover your product...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that? This is the wife of narcotrafficker Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me buy you a drink. Isabella pauses.  Crockett may get killed right now.  The near the open doors to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you like to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a fiend for mojitas. Isabella looks over at Crockett's boat.  Back to Crockett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast does that go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes very fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me...? Isabella and Crockett head outside towards the dock, Tubb overtakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you for a second, partner...? They step aside. TUBBS (cont'd) (low, re:  Isabella)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha's up...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing. And he leaves to help Isabella board.  Switek unties and pushes off the boat.  Looking out the window at them is J Yero, as perplexed as Tubbs, who covers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...secure satellite comms. encrypted e-mail, the longs and lats for the transshipment point...all that?  It's all cool. But I need a vector, not a location.  'Cause ships move. That's why they call them ships. Ship stops?  It's trying to be an apartment building.  At sea that attracts attention.  That's bad... Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulling away from the docks at 12 knots, repressing the thunder of the 2,700-horsepower engines.  Crockett leaves canopy slid back.  They're open to the air.  He gives Isabella headsets so they can talk over the roar.  The wi starts to move her hair.  She's not sure how to put on th headset. Crockett lets the boat rock over the swells while he arra her headset around her ears.  His fingers brush her hair, touch her skin... It was not intentional.  But the look in Crockett's eyes as if a small voltage passed through him. He plugs her headset into the dash, regains the wheel, sh the throttles forward and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cuts and then leaps over swells.  In seven seconds they'r doing over 70 knots.  And Crockett holds it there as...

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogues.text: The wind whips her hair behind her, now.  The two are sma against the smooth 50' long hull.  Crockett hands her wraparound shades for her eyes.  She doesn't want them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through headset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the best place for mojitas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodeguita del Medio.  It's the only place for mojitas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a little alley with cobblestones.  Hemingway went there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havana?  Cubans don't like us or my business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid? (smiles; Crockett shakes his head "no")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  And you don't need a visa. Cause you're with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rockets from one swell to the next, getting airborne.  Wi and salt electrify Isabella.  She turns to Crockett and smiles, putting on the glasses, now.  Crockett gestures t her knees.  She should keep them bent.  Crockett pushes i 75 knots...

dialogues.speaker: FRONTAL
dialogues.text: in strong light, ripped by wind.  Behind them are ocean a sky and twenty-foot plumes which jet from the props and m a wake that vectors in diagonals to what each is leaving behind them...where they've been...and converge to push t to the new places where they're headed.  Behind, the skie are leaden.  They're racing a storm.  Sunlight shafts thr a gap in thunderclouds, turning the clouds yellow.  Now, turn peach against the darkening open water and the grey behind.  The boat vibrates, the engines scream and...

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: waves her over to join him behind the wheel.  He holds ou his left hand to steady her.  He brings her to him.  Both lean against his high upholstered chair.  He holds her to side.  Indicates the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light touch.  Everything comes to you through the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: stays on the throttle, throttling back when the props are of the water so you don't redline the engine and forward when reentering.  The swells are now four feet.  They lau off each, get airborne, cut into the next... CROCKETT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get into Cuba?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin is the harbor master. You must not bring in drugs.  You cannot be armed.  If you're carrying, it has to go.  Or stow it inside.  No one will go near your boat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do business in Cuba with your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never do business in Cuba. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody goes to Cuba but me. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he is not my husband... Crockett's surprised.  And he doesn't push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you born in Havana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angola.  My mother was being a surgeon there.  She volunteered. Mozambique and Mali, too... (over the wind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...those days, in those days...she was part of Cuba's gift to the third world.  She came from a bourgeois family with a house in Verdado...we still have the house. We will go there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead... Crockett looks at her.  Her perspective is that of the '6 and '70's, the politics of national liberation, the perspective of Marcuse and Franz Fanon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angolan Military.  Went back to the fighting.  Disappeared.  Who knows...? Isabella looks at the look on Crockett's face. ISABELLA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and ask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he not your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am no one's wife.  I live in my own house.  I do not live in a man's house.  He has a wife.  We are together.  I am free.  Because of banking and finance and travel... (looks at him, shouts over wind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can do anything I want... She laughs.  She has that combination of intellect, beaut and youth.  Everything is possible...life will never end...she can ride this crest eternally. And Crockett knows that her confidence makes her obliviou peril, makes "right now" too real because she believes sh will live forever.

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: can't help it.  He looks right at her.  She lifts her fac the spray.  Some clouds part and light strikes her... And Crockett wants to possess her; to protect her.  He wa no one else to have her.  He wants no harm to come to her And this is an impulse that takes him over to the core of he is.  And, as we MOVE IN CLOSER, Crockett has to turn away...

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogues.text: sees this.  She's quizzical.  Crockett looks back at her. Their eyes connect.

dialogues.speaker: "BORN TO WIN"
dialogues.text: leaps...

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: his left arm around her shoulder, his right on the wheel. She rocks back against his body.  They rip across the sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14-piece Afro-Cuban band.  IN THE PRESS OF dancers at a s table, Crockett and Isabella...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts over noise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mojitas...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later!  Do you dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dance... They move into the crowd under two-story high windows overlooking Meyer Lansky's Hotel Riviera - freeze-dried 1 Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: Whatever we knew about Sonny Crockett, we did not know he could dance.  Their feet, their knees and thighs, perfect matched, they samba, like lightning. He swings her around and turns her to a close embrace as their hips and legs parallel each other's, as he turns he under his arm, stops her, pulls her backwards into his bo her hips into his, the fast beat, the footwork, and he sp her back facing him, pressing her closer as it gets faste and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fall onto a bed, shedding the last of their clothes, maki love in a house somewhere.  Beyond them is an open window the ocean.  The sky turns red and grey but the water stay molten. Their eyes are open...because they're locked together the whole time and their faces are steady and urgently surpri because this is not language; not a symbol, not a representation of a thing.  Jesus Montoya is not here.  M is not here.  This is discovery.  This is fact.  They hav discovered each other and have never felt like this about anyone before in their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open.  He wakes up.  Light and situation flood i He does not know where he is.  He pulls on his pants. Barefoot, he walks to the window.  The interior is high- ceilinged with immaculately polished floors.  And Crocket looks around, a stranger in a stranger place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters.  The paint on the outside of this house is peelin and patinaed with stain.  The yard is overgrown.  The stu fence around the streamline deco facade is crumbling from weather and time...

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT WATCHES THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: from the balcony of the futuristic villa in Verdado...  A futurism from 1939, peeling aqua, aging science fiction. Wherever we are in the world, this place is out of the stream, outside history.  And Isabella, this woman from a different world, enters, brings him an oversized cup of coffee.  In his trousers, Crockett drapes an arm across h shoulders and they stand in the air.

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: hears voices from the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My aunt.  She's ancient.  She looks after the place... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my mother's family's home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the funky yellow restaurant drinking mojitas.  They've lunch served to them at the bar.  Frosted glasses have su on the bottom and are loaded with crushed Cuban herbs.  T bartender has been there for 40 years.  Crockett and Isab look like regulars.  They've served chicken and plantains Like any restaurant, the people eating at the bar are the regulars.  They sit where Hemingway sat in the slow part the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Macon, Georgia is where I was born. Wound up in a juvenile facility.  I was 14.  Then the military.  Then prison.  Because I was dumb and angry.  Then I read.  Then I got smart.  Then I discovered what I know, now...it's all business... Isabella smiles. CROCKETT (cont'd) (to Bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend, two more. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your mother's name...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanca...a rubio like you. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see her in a dress...an old photograph from Lucinda somebody's wedding...everybody is with couples.  Husbands and wives.  They all pose.  My mother is alone because my father had to go back to the fighting. (she points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she looks right into the camera. She is the most beautiful woman in the room.  By herself.  In a party dress.  And she looked like she knew she would die alone... (beat...remembers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spoke many languages.  We were in Luanda when she died.  I went to her friends in Mali.  They sent me to the Ecole Polytechnique in Geneva to study mathematics, where I met Montoya in the discos.  He had banking there...I was seventeen and very much into the clubs.  And he sent me to University for an MBA in Finance. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Died in childbirth, having me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To mothers.  And all that we owe them... Isabella looks at Crockett and smiles and puts on her sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how improbable this is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Probable"...applies to an event that may be real.  Doesn't apply here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...'cause we have no future...are of today and not tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and therafore there is no consequence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Crockett's hand is around her waist and slips down her hi he pulls her closer and takes off her glasses and she put down her drink and kisses him at the bar and Crockett's e dwell on her and she looks back at him and, now, knowing he's thinking...

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: The water is like sheet metal as clouds allow only a sliv of light to illuminate the sea while rain greys-out most it.  Minute crimson is a freighter heading to the stone harbor.  Fabric billows in the wind.  PULL BACK into the to Crockett and Isabella...

dialogues.speaker: TWO NAKED BODIES
dialogues.text: ...one light skinned, the other brown, intertwine in the opiated moments after sensuality.  The afternoon half-lig drapes parts of their bodies, making a relief against whi their eyes hold each other's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: focused elsewhere.  It's as if he's struggling to record event of her in memory so she'll sustain there, because h compels himself to a different place, now.  Then, the sho curtain parts.  It startles him...

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogues.text: enters.  She touches his back.  He turns to her with a sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk deliveries. Isabella is not let down by the switch to commerce.  She merely goes there, too.  After all, this is their subject Soft smiles. CROCKETT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a different kind of deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like "three thousand a ki?"  That's nice. And I can supply the transportation into South Florida and the Gulf, more reliable and on-time than FedEx.  But, three per ki was OK for openers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why should continuing excellence cost more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cost less.  That's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it December?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Christmas come early this year...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than that. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We become partners.  Only in this territory and only on loads we run. And you don't pay us three thousand a ki.  You pay us zero.  Why we get is thirty percent of the load. Product or cash.  "And why," you're thinking, "would I be crazy enough to out in these gringos like that? Is he chipping?  Crazy for my love? Too many mojitas?"  And the answer is, "of course" but also "no.  It is because Sonny can deliver what no one else can."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good samba dancing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you don't lose loads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause we guarantee every load. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere, for any reason, it comes up short, we make good.  Your operations will, from now on, run risk-free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're our thirty-percent partner? Her knowing smile speaks of experience beyond her years. ISABELLA (cont'd) (deadly seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I tell you that your ideas are too big for your skin? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That merely to propose this is a dangerous thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I would say to you, this has been fun... There's a long pause.  This is business.  This is what is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The range should be between fifteen and seventeen-point-five percent of the P.O.E....to even consider it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need thirty.  Calculate in, also, the cash you don't have to front...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Available cash is not an issue for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-eight-point-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I pushed to twenty-one...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say you're... (hesitates; holds up four fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...four percentage points away from a deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm only one. And she slides into his arms.  And smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do it at twenty-two... Isabella laughs.  She kisses him under the shower water. it's tough to know who is pushing it further out onto the edge. CROCKETT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I make you breakfast again... Her breathing is heavier as she buries her head in his ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crockett is alone.  Black skies mottled with grey.

dialogues.speaker: CROCKETT
dialogues.text: Rain and wind rip across his face.  He left Isabella in Havana.

dialogues.speaker: SATELLITE PHONE
dialogues.text: rings.  Crockett picks it up.  It's Tubbs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way back... Crockett disconnects.  He pushes it.  It launches from on swell, airborne, and knifes into the next.  It's violent. Crockett's thoughts and expression are about Isabella.  T are criminal conspirators, a woman cheating on her narcotrafficker "husband," an outlaw smuggler who's reall undercover cop...

dialogues.speaker: OVER CROCKETT
dialogues.text: rockets in and then throttles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting on the U-shaped jetty as we HEAR Crockett kill th engines, tying it off.  Gina stands halfway up the small to the early 60's ranch house under tropical palms.  Tubb mood is dark.  As Crockett approaches, he looks blankly a Tubbs, offering no explanation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meet with Castillo and the fed got set up.  It's in 45 minutes... Tubbs goes inside.  Crockett follows.  As he passes Gina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Sonny...? Crockett looks at her.  He has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters.  While Tubbs is strapping up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit a couple of jazz clubs.  Fell back to her place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verdado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verdado where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the suburbs outside Havana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Havana, Cuba...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Havana, Louisiana. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't we have a meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where you're makin' a move on the wife of Archangel de Jesus Montoya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not makin' a move on her...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're makin' moves on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that makes it okay, then.

dialogues.speaker: AND TIED-UP ON THE INDIAN RIVER
dialogues.text: We've entered a secret meeting mid-argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said, "go exploring"?  We want this staying on track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fujima)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the "we"?  There's you and there's us.  And all we got from you was bad intel.  "Low-level producer."  Yeah, right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Just like I said. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know we can't ever see each other again.  And we never will. Isabella sits there for a moment.  She glances at him, lo away.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said time is luck... Meaning, who can tell?  There may be a time for them somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck ran out. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was too good to last. He touches her hand.  And she leans all her weight agains his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: asleep.  The moonlight is silver tinged with green.  Some else had been in the bed with him, but he is there alone, now.  Crockett wakes up.  He looks around.  She was there now she's gone. He gets out of the bed and looks out to the ocean and the jetty.  The boat's gone.  She's gone.  Sonny Crockett loo out the window.
